DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Source sold operation 5/13/08. New owner does not store a regulated substance

_exec_summary.SummaryText: It is the policy of this company that the prevention of accidents and injuries to our employees shall be integrated into all aspects of our work activity.  Nothing is more important than the lives and well-being of our employees, customers and the general public.  The practice of safety is considered an essential part of each employee's job performance at this company.  This company has monthly in-house safety meetings and attends Illinois Propane Gas Association additional training on a regular basis.  We are constantly changing to keep up with industry changes and requirements.  Our vehicles and equipment are inspected on a daily basis as well as various monthly and annual requirements.  Our vehicles are equipped with remote and emergency shut offs.  We do take safety seriously and have been free of accidents for at least the past five years.  Our safety and risk management program also include notifications and evacuations of each person living within the area that could be affected if such accident would occur.  Our facility holds (2) 30,000 gallon storage tanks of propane, (6) bobtails (delivery trucks), and a variety of bottled cylinders.  Our primary function is to deliver propane gas for residential heating needs and for industrial forklift usage.   Our company works closely with local emergency responders including the DeKalb County LEPC, the Cortland Fire Department, the DeKalb Fire Department and the DeKalb County Sherrif's office.  Reporting and updating are submitted to these organizations on an annual basis.  Our company is also in compliance with various state and federal agencies including, but not limited to: the IEMA, EPA, DOT and OSHA.
